alert.note: Alert for Letcher; Martin; Pike (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 25 at 9:21AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Martin and Pike Counties through 945 AM EDT... At 921 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Mcandrews, or 8 miles south of Williamson, moving south at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Coleman and Kimper around 925 AM EDT. Biggs, Fedscreek, Phyllis, Paw Paw and Fishtrap Lake around 930 AM EDT. Toonerville, Mouthcard and Belcher around 935 AM EDT. Elkhorn City and Cedarville around 940 AM EDT. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... U.S. Highway 119 in Pike County between mile markers 1 and 24. U.S. Highway 23 in Pike County between mile markers 3 and 29. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
